definition[0]: someone who gets advantages from an action or change
example[0]: The rich were the main beneficiaries of the tax cuts.
definition[1]: someone who receives money or property from someone else who has died
example[1]: He was the chief beneficiary of his father’s will.
definition[2]: a person who receives money or property from someone who has died
example[2]: Dorothy’s son was her sole beneficiary.
definition[3]: any person or organization that gets an advantage or help from something
example[3]: Oil companies were the main beneficiaries of the budget.
